data.title: European Theater
data.description: The conflict across Europe involving Axis and Allied powers.

data.title: Western Front
data.description: The military arena covering Western Europe and Scandinavia.

data.title: Invasion of Poland
data.description: German forces cross the Polish border triggering the start of WWII.

data.title: UK/France Declaration
data.description: Britain and France declare war on Germany following the Polish invasion.

data.title: Operation Weser√ºbung
data.description: German invasion of Denmark and Norway to secure iron ore.

data.title: Dunkirk Evacuation
data.description: Operation Dynamo: The rescue of 338000 Allied troops from France.

data.title: Battle of Britain
data.description: The Royal Air Force defends the UK against the Luftwaffe.

data.title: The Blitz
data.description: Sustained strategic bombing of British cities by Germany.

data.title: D-Day
data.description: The Allied amphibious invasion of Normandy (Operation Overlord).

data.title: Liberation of Paris
data.description: Allied and Free French forces reclaim the French capital.

data.title: Operation Market Garden
data.description: Allied paratrooper operation to capture bridges in the Netherlands.

data.title: Battle of the Bulge
data.description: The final German counter-offensive in the Ardennes forest.

data.title: German Surrender
data.description: The signing of unconditional surrender by German high command.

data.title: Eastern Front
data.description: The massive conflict between Nazi Germany and the Soviet Union.

data.title: Operation Barbarossa
data.description: The launch of the German invasion of the Soviet Union.

data.title: Battle of Moscow
data.description: Soviet defense of the capital and the first major German retreat.

data.title: Battle of Stalingrad
data.description: Decisive Soviet victory that destroyed the German 6th Army.

data.title: Battle of Kursk
data.description: The largest armored engagement in military history.

data.title: Operation Bagration
data.description: Major Soviet offensive that destroyed the German Army Group Center.

data.title: Battle of Berlin
data.description: Final Soviet offensive capturing the heart of the Third Reich.

data.title: Suicide of Hitler
data.description: Adolf Hitler commits suicide in his Berlin bunker.

data.title: Far East Theater
data.description: The conflict spanning East Asia and the Pacific Ocean.

data.title: Pearl Harbor
data.description: The Japanese surprise attack on the US fleet in Hawaii.

data.title: Fall of Singapore
data.description: The surrender of the British base to Japanese forces.

data.title: Bataan Death March
data.description: Forced march of US and Filipino POWs after the fall of Bataan.

data.title: Doolittle Raid
data.description: The first US air raid on Tokyo following Pearl Harbor.

data.title: Battle of the Coral Sea
data.description: First carrier-vs-carrier battle stopping Japanese expansion.

data.title: Battle of Midway
data.description: Turning point in the Pacific where US sank 4 Japanese carriers.

data.title: Guadalcanal Campaign
data.description: Six-month battle for control of the Solomon Islands.

data.title: Battle of the Philippine Sea
data.description: The 'Great Marianas Turkey Shoot' air battle.

data.title: Battle of Leyte Gulf
data.description: History's largest naval battle; decimation of Japanese Navy.

data.title: Battle of Iwo Jima
data.description: US capture of the strategic island to provide airbases.

data.title: Battle of Okinawa
data.description: The largest amphibious assault in the Pacific theater.

data.title: Hiroshima Bombing
data.description: Atomic bombing of Hiroshima by the B-29 Enola Gay.

data.title: Nagasaki Bombing
data.description: The second atomic bomb dropped on Nagasaki.

data.title: V-J Day
data.description: Japan announces unconditional surrender.

data.title: Marco Polo Bridge Incident
data.description: Start of the Second Sino-Japanese War.

data.title: Nanking Massacre
data.description: Atrocities committed by Japanese forces in Nanking.

data.title: The Hump
data.description: US airlift of supplies over the Himalayas to China.

data.title: Battle of Imphal/Kohima
data.description: Japanese defeat in India marking a turning point in CBI.

data.title: Other Theaters
data.description: Global operations outside Europe and Pacific.

data.title: Siege of Tobruk
data.description: Allied defense of the Libyan port against Rommel.

data.title: Second Battle of El Alamein
data.description: The British 8th Army breaks the Axis line in Egypt.

data.title: Operation Torch
data.description: Allied landings in Morocco and Algeria.

data.title: Battle of Kasserine Pass
data.description: The first major engagement between US and German forces.

data.title: Italian Front
data.description: The Allied campaign to knock Italy out of the war.

data.title: Invasion of Sicily
data.description: Operation Husky: Landings by US and UK forces.

data.title: Italian Armistice
data.description: Italy signs a secret armistice with the Allies.

data.title: Battle of Monte Cassino
data.description: A bloody struggle for the Gustav Line in Italy.

data.title: Battle of Anzio
data.description: Allied landing behind German lines near Rome.

data.title: Liberation of Rome
data.description: Allied forces enter Rome after months of stalemate.

data.title: Anglo-Iraqi War
data.description: Conflict to secure Iraq against pro-Axis elements.

data.title: Invasion of Iran
data.description: Joint Anglo-Soviet move to secure oil and supply routes.

data.title: Naval/Strategic Campaigns
data.description: Global oceanic and political events.

data.title: Battle of the Atlantic
data.description: The struggle for control of Allied supply lines.

data.title: Battle of the River Plate
data.description: The first naval battle of the war in South America.

data.title: Sinking of the Bismarck
data.description: Royal Navy sinks Germany's greatest battleship.

data.title: Atlantic Charter
data.description: Policy statement issued by Churchill and FDR.

data.title: Wannsee Conference
data.description: Nazi coordination of the Final Solution.

data.title: Casablanca Conference
data.description: Allied strategy meeting in Morocco.

data.title: Bretton Woods Conference
data.description: Establishment of the post-war financial system.

data.title: July 20 Plot
data.description: Assassination attempt on Hitler at the Wolf's Lair.

data.title: Yalta Conference
data.description: Planning the post-war division of Europe.

data.title: Death of FDR
data.description: The passing of the US President during the war.

data.title: UN Charter Signed
data.description: Establishment of the United Nations in San Francisco.

data.title: Trinity Test
data.description: The first successful detonation of a nuclear weapon.

data.title: Nuremberg Trials
data.description: War crimes trials for the Nazi leadership.

data.title: The Manhattan Project
data.description: The top-secret development of the atomic bomb.

data.title: The Winter War
data.description: Conflict between the Soviet Union and Finland.

data.title: Resistance Movement
data.description: The underground struggle against Nazi occupation.

data.title: Japanese Invasion of Burma
data.description: Japan seizes Burma to cut the Burma Road supply line.

data.title: Battle of the Rhineland
data.description: Allies clear the west bank of the Rhine river.

data.title: Liberation of Auschwitz
data.description: Soviet forces discover the main Nazi death camp.

data.title: Siege of Leningrad
data.description: A brutal 872-day siege of the Soviet city by German forces.

data.title: Pacific Ocean Front
data.description: Naval and amphibious campaigns across Pacific islands.

data.title: China Burma India Theater
data.description: Land operations across mainland Asia and India.

data.title: North African Campaign
data.description: The desert war in Egypt

data.title: WWII Diplomatic Summits
data.description: A series of international conferences that determined the course of the war and the post-war world order.

data.title: Munich Agreement
data.description: Leaders of Germany, Great Britain, France, and Italy meet to discuss the Sudetenland. The height of the policy of appeasement.

data.title: Wannsee Conference
data.description: Senior Nazi officials meet in Berlin to coordinate the implementation of the 'Final Solution' to the Jewish Question.

data.title: Trident Conference
data.description: Strategic meeting in Washington, D.C., to discuss the invasion of Sicily and the timing of the cross-channel invasion.

data.title: First Quebec Conference
data.description: Codenamed 'Quadrant', this meeting finalized the plans for Operation Overlord and the invasion of France.

data.title: Moscow Conference
data.description: Foreign ministers of the 'Big Three' meet to establish the European Advisory Commission and plan for the post-war period.

data.title: Cairo Conference
data.description: FDR, Churchill, and Chiang Kai-shek meet to discuss the progress of the war against Japan and post-war Asia.

data.title: Tehran Conference
data.description: The first meeting of the 'Big Three' (Stalin, Roosevelt, Churchill) to coordinate military strategy against Germany.

data.title: Bretton Woods Conference
data.description: Representatives from 44 nations meet to design a new international monetary system and create the IMF and World Bank.

data.title: Dumbarton Oaks Conference
data.description: Delegates from the US, UK, USSR, and China meet to draft the proposals for the formation of the United Nations.

data.title: Moscow Conference (1944)
data.description: Churchill and Stalin meet to discuss the 'Percentages Agreement' regarding spheres of influence in Southeast Europe.

data.title: Malta Conference
data.description: Combined Chiefs of Staff meeting to plan the final campaigns in the European Theater prior to the meeting at Yalta.

data.title: Yalta Conference
data.description: The 'Big Three' meet at Livadia Palace to discuss the re-establishment of the nations of war-torn Europe.

data.title: San Francisco Conference
data.description: The United Nations Conference on International Organization, resulting in the signing of the UN Charter.

data.title: Potsdam Conference
data.description: Truman, Stalin, and Attlee meet to negotiate terms for the end of the war and the post-war order in Germany.

data.title: Munich Agreement
data.description: Leaders of Germany, Great Britain, France, and Italy meet to discuss the Sudetenland. The height of the policy of appeasement.

data.title: Atlantic Conference
data.description: FDR and Churchill meet secretly aboard warships off Newfoundland to draft the Atlantic Charter, defining Allied goals.

data.title: Wannsee Conference
data.description: Senior Nazi officials meet in Berlin to coordinate the implementation of the 'Final Solution' to the Jewish Question.

data.title: Casablanca Conference
data.description: FDR and Churchill plan the Italian campaign and cross-channel invasion, and announce the 'unconditional surrender' policy.
